title: Working with Your Inner Critic
subtitle: Transform self-attack into self-leadership
description: Learn to recognize, understand, and transform the harsh inner voice that keeps you small. This course teaches you practical techniques for shifting from self-criticism to self-compassion without losing your drive for growth.

modules.title: Understanding the Inner Critic
modules.description: What it is, where it comes from, and why it's so powerful

modules.title: Mapping Your Critic
modules.description: Identifying your specific critic patterns and triggers

modules.title: Changing the Relationship
modules.description: From enemy to informant - a new way of relating

whatYouLearn: Recognize your inner critic's voice and patterns
Understand the protective function behind self-criticism
Techniques to interrupt critic attacks in real-time
How to extract useful information without the abuse
Build a supportive inner voice that motivates without harm
Daily practices for ongoing critic management
requirements: Willingness to observe your inner dialogue
Openness to self-compassion (even if it feels uncomfortable)
Journal or notes app for exercises

questions.question: What is the typical origin of the inner critic?
options: It's a sign of mental illness
Internalized voices from caregivers and environment trying to protect us

questions.question: What is the inner critic trying to do at its core?
options: Protect you from pain, rejection, or failure

questions.question: What is a healthier relationship with the inner critic?
options: Acknowledging it, extracting useful information, but not letting it lead

questions.question: What is the 'inner ally' or 'inner mentor'?
options: A supportive inner voice that motivates without cruelty

questions.question: Why doesn't fighting or suppressing the inner critic work long-term?
options: It strengthens the part by treating it as an enemy rather than addressing its concerns

questions.question: What's the difference between healthy self-evaluation and critic attacks?
options: Healthy evaluation is specific, useful, and kind; critic attacks are global, shaming, and harsh
